lines.text: Do you know a guy named Billy Sanchez?
Why are you lookin' for him? He ain't no good for nothing.
I don't want him for nothin', I just want to talk to him.
He ain't even good for that.

Well, even white people don't make things any good anymore. I bought a US made TV because I wanted to buy American. And it broke down in three weeks. When the repair man came to fix it he said all the parts were made in Japan anyway. So next time I'm gonna buy one straight from Japan.
I found them.
Who?
The men who killed my son.
I'll just get my gear.
They're in a whorehouse over in Juarez right now. There's the four that came into my home, and there's eight or ten others.
Let's go clean em' up.
[first lines]
Major, I sure do hate to face all them people.
Then put your glasses on, John.
What the fuck are you doing?
I'm gonna kill a bunch of people.
Why do I always get stuck with crazy men?
'Cause that's the only kind that's left.

Good to be back. We knew all along, that everyone back home from the President on down was behind us 100%. It was God and faith in our families that kept us going. Speaking for myself, I'd like to say that the whole experience has made a better man, a better officer and a better American out of me. Thank you very much.
You've changed your hair.
Yeah. About 100 times in the last 3 weeks.
And you're not wearing a brassiere.
Nobody wears them any more. Didn't they tell you that?
No. They told us about mini-skirts but I never thought we'd get to see one.
Oh, I have one, do you want me to try it on?
You don't have to do that.
I don't think I'm up for any more of this. Why don't you go to bed? We'll work this all out.
What are you gonna do?
I'm just gonna sit here.
I work here at night.
Then what are you doing here now?
You're the strong silent type, aren't you?
Nah, I'm just a little rusty on my smalltalk.
You learn to love the rope. That's how you beat 'em. That's how you beat people who torture you. You learn to love 'em. Then they don't know you're beatin' 'em.

Hello Major. Saw you on TV. You looked good. You really did, you looked good. We also saw 'em give you a whole shitload full of silver dollars. And me an' the boys, we were in the neighborhood and we thought maybe you should give us some of them silver dollars.
Now you are gonna tell us where that money is sooner or later. I would suggest sooner, 'cause later may be too late.
Now don't... give me any of that officer hard shit. 'Cause I was right there in 'Nam with the rest of you, 'cept I was laying face-down in the mud while you cats was flying over.

[pulling hook from Lopez' hand and leaving]
You could lose a hand like that.
Man, I have had it with lying men, Charlie. The ones who say one thing and do another. The ones that always let you down. Are you gonna let me down?
Depends on what you're lookin' for.
I hope you're not just stringing me along, Charlie Rane. I hope that's not all you're doin'.
I don't have to do that, do I?
Maybe you do. How old do you think I am?

[smiles]
Almost thirty. Been around the course a couple times now.
Well you sure don't look it.
Well I do in the morning. And after I've been out partying all night. I do when I'm sitting alone brooding about some worthless man. I've had a few of 'em, you know?
What are you getting at?
Only that you can trust me. And I wanna know I can trust you. I wanna help.
Let's get outta here.
Charlie, you are the quietest man I've ever known.

That's cause I can't think of anything to say. It's like my eyes are open and I'm looking at you but I'm dead. They've pulled out whatever it was inside of me. It never hurt at all after that and it never will.
30 minutes - 30 dollars.
Goddamn, I wanted to rent you, not buy you.
If you're looking for a cheap thrill, why don't you go to the dog races.

[Last stand]
Get your ass down here, flyboy!
Charlie... I was so nervous that... uh... Cliff came by to drive us up. You remember Cliff.

[to Mark, Rane's son]
Hey, runt! Not over there. C'mon. Get in back with your daddy. C'mon, runt. Let's move it! C'mon!
Do you remember what I looked like as a baby?
Sure I do, every last detail.

[to his son]
You don't remember me, do you.
I tell ya... the men around here don't respect anything. If I told you all the guys that called me up... A lot of your friends from the base - I didn't even look at 'em.
I had everything worked out but nothing's gone the way I planned.
Why's he staying out in the wood shed?
Just 'cause it's small and quiet out there.
I sure didn't want it to work out like this.
I didn't either.
Bebe, the man is thirsty.
Well you sure shouldn't be.
I'd like to thank you too for wearing my bracelet all that time. I really appreciate that.
It's the very least I could do. I'd like to do more.
Listen Cliff, I hope you don't mind me saying this to you but I'd really appreciate it if you didn't call my kid a runt.
You dumb asshole, how does it feel to have gone through all this for nothing?
You got yourself a groupie major.
What's a groupie? That word's a little after my time.

Well a groupie is a girl who falls in love with a rock star or a movie star, somebody she doesn't know. Worships him... knows she's never gonna meet him but, uh, if she ever does she'll do anything for him. Anything... she can.
You're lookin' for those guys, aren't you? Aren't you? You know who they are, don't you? Don't you?
Some of them.
Well why don't you just tell the police?
Because I want to find all of 'em.
You know you don't have to do any of this. You don't have to go after these guys. We could just jump in the car and go a thousand miles from here and nobody'd know any different.

[to Texan]
It's your time, boy!
You tellin' me you've never heard of Melio, T-bird, or Automatic Slim?
I'm gonna need a vacation when this vacation's over. Feel like I've been gone two years instead of two days.
I mean... uh, I've been in some scrapes, I know what I can do. But... uh, well, anyone who wasn't over there has to ask himself, if he could've taken it. You know, gettin' tortured and all.
I wanna get my hands on those murdering bastards.
That'll pass Cliff, everything passes.
Fat Ed likes beautiful gringo girls. I like beautiful gringo girls. Every body likes beautiful gringo girls!
That there is the last American factory-made convertible.
No more convertibles?
No ma'am. Those things cost a fortune too.
The Japanese'll start making 'em. That's what happens. We'll be buying our Cadillac convertibles from Japan.
